Description: Body fragment of East Greek pottery closed vessel. Goat, leaping to right, preserved part of the rear thigh, the elongated belly, and the tips of its horns; in the field, ornament; added red on the ribs and for the band below the frieze.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 8, no. 17 pl. 4)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.891)
